result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Lloyd Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam Lloyd Douglas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam Lloyd Douglas was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

COUNT TWO DISMISSED.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 1110 1/2 N 6th St., Wausau WI  54403 marked   "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."
Filed by Atty. Peter Masana
Filed by Atty. Peter Masana

Cases called 11CF499 & 14CF54, Defendant Adam Lloyd Douglas in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 (possess paraphernalia) in 14CF54. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: $518 costs. Pled no contest to ct. 6 (theft) in 11CF499, 1 yr. probation, $453 costs, $286 restitution. All other counts in both cases dismissed. In 11CF499 41 days jail credit, in 14CF54, no jail credit.
